trans-unit.source: Represents the subject of a SAML security token.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify the subject of the security token.
The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements.
The SAML specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement>.
A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement> asserts the principal that is the subject of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token.
This principal is specified using a SamlSubject class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> class.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.IsReadOnly%2A> property to `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> class using the specified name, the domain in which the name resides, and the format the name is in.
Although the format used to specify a name is extensible, the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.

|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.|
A URI reference that represents the format that the `name` parameter is in.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat*> property.
The domain in which the `name` parameter resides.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier*> property.
The subject name.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name*> property.
name is or is .

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> class using the specified name, the domain in which the name resides, the format the name is in, authentication protocols, additional authentication information, and a key identifier.
The format used to specify a name for the `name` parameter is extensible; the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.

|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.| The set of authentication protocols to specify for the `confirmations` parameter is extensible; however the following table lists the protocols defined by the SAML specification.

|Protocol|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.HolderOfKey%2A>|A URI that specifies that the recipient of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token should use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.SenderVouches%2A>|A URI that specifies that additional information is not available for a recipient of a SAML security token to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.|
A URI reference that represents the format that the `name` parameter is in.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat*> property.
The domain in which the `name` parameter resides.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier*> property.
The subject name.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name*> property.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> of type <xref:System.String> that contains URI references that identify the protocols to authenticate the subject.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ConfirmationMethods*> property.
Additional authentication information that can be used by authentication protocols.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.SubjectConfirmationData*> property.

A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> that provides access to a cryptographic key held by the subject of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier*> property.
name is or is .
confirmations contains a or member.
-or- confirmations does not contain any members and name is or is .
-or- confirmations does not contain any members and confirmationData or securityKeyIdentifier are not .
Gets a set of URI references that identify the protocols that should be used to authenticate the subject.
Although the set of authentication protocols s extensible, the following table lists the protocols defined by the SAML specification.

|Protocol|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.HolderOfKey%2A>|A URI that specifies that the recipient of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token should use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.SenderVouches%2A>|A URI that specifies that additional information is not available for a recipient of a SAML security token to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.|
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of type <xref:System.String> that contains a set of URI references that identify the protocols that should be used to authenticate the subject.
Gets or sets the cryptographic key that is used to verify the digital signature that is identified by this SAML subject statement.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> method is called, the cryptographic key specified in the `<ds:KeyInfo>` element of the digital signature for the SAML security token is used to set the Crypto property.
This cryptographic key identifies the subject.
The key identifier for the `<ds:KeyInfo>` element is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that contains the cryptographic key that is used to verify the digital signature for a SAML security token.
Gets a set of claims using the properties of this class.
Use the ExtractClaims method to get a set of claims associated with the identity of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token.

A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> that contains the set of claims represented by this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> instance.
Gets a set of claims using the properties of this class and the specified SAML security token authenticator.
Use the ExtractSubjectKeyClaimSet method to get a set of claims associated with the identity of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token.

A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator"></xref> that authenticates the portion of a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token that corresponds to the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:Subject>" name="<saml:Subject>" href=""></xref> element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref> that contains the set of claims represented by this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> instance.
samlAuthenticator is .
Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a key identifier that provides access to a cryptographic key held by the subject of the SAML security token.

The key included in the key identifier that is represented by the KeyIdentifier property is decrypted and set to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Crypto%2A> property when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> method is called.
The KeyIdentifier property corresponds to the `<ds:KeyInfo>` child element of a `<saml:SubjectConfirmation>` element of a SAML assertion.

A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> that provides access to a cryptographic key held by the subject of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
Causes this instance to be read-only.
When the MakeReadOnly method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
Gets or sets the subject name of a SAML security token.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property specifies the format that the Name property is in and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property specifies the domain in which the Name property resides in.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property corresponds to the `Format` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The subject name of a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
Gets the claim type that is used to represent the subject name of a SAML security token.
The NameClaimType returns a claim type for <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property.
The claim type that is used to represent the subject name of a SAML security token (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimTypes.NameIdentifier*>).
Gets or sets a URI reference that represents the format that the subject name of a SAML security token is in.
The NameFormat property specifies the format that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property is in.
Although the format used to specify a name is extensible, the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.

|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.| The NameFormat property corresponds to the `Format` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
A URI reference that represents the format that the subject name of a SAML security token is in.
Gets or sets the domain in which the subject name of a SAML security token resides in.
The NameQualifier property specifies the domain in which the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property resides in.

The NameQualifier property corresponds to the `NameQualifier` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The domain in which the subject name of a SAML security token resides in.
Reads the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:Subject>" name="<saml:Subject>" href=""></xref> element from the specified XML reader.

The ReadXml method sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ConfirmationMethods%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Crypto%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.SubjectConfirmationData%2A> properties.
A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader> to read the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:Subject>" name="<saml:Subject>" href=""></xref> element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in a SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that reads the <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clause of the digital signature.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader is .
-or- samlSerializer is .
reader refers to an XML element in which one of the following is true: Contains an element without a value.
-or- Contains an <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:ConfirmationMehtod>" name="<saml:ConfirmationMehtod>" href=""></xref> element without a value.

-or- Contains a <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:SubjectConfirmation>" name="<saml:SubjectConfirmation>" href=""></xref> element that does not have at least one <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:ConfirmationMethod>" name="<saml:ConfirmationMethod>" href=""></xref> child element.

-or- Does not contain at least one <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:ConfirmationMethod>" name="<saml:ConfirmationMethod>" href=""></xref> or <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:NameIdentifier>" name="<saml:NameIdentifier>" href=""></xref> element.
reader refers to an XML element that contains a element that does not have a key that can be retrieved.
Gets or sets additional authentication information that can be used by authentication protocols.
The SubjectConfirmationData property refers to an extensible piece of data that can be customized for a specific authentication protocol.

The SubjectConfirmationData property corresponds to the `<saml:SubjectConfirmationData>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
Additional authentication information that can be used by authentication protocols.
Writes the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:Subject>" name="<saml:Subject>" href=""></xref> element into the specified XML serializer.
Use the WriteXml method to write the properties of the current <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> instance into a `<saml:Subject>` element.
A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter> to write the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:Subject>" name="<saml:Subject>" href=""></xref> element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clauses.
